description: From Old English lāc, from Proto-Germanic *laiką (“game, dance, hymn, sport, fight”). Cognates include Old Norse leikr (whence Danish leg (“game”), Swedish leka (“to play”)), Gothic 𐌻𐌰𐌹𐌺𐍃 (laiks, “dance”). Doublet of lek.

verbs.description: laik (third-person singular simple present laiks, present participle laiking, simple past and past participle laiked)

entries.meaning: (UK, Northern, dialect) To play (in the sense opposed to work).
